In a 45-45-90 triangle:
1. The two legs (sides adjacent to the right angle) are equal in length.
2. If we assume each leg has a length of 1 unit, then the hypotenuse will have a length of √2 units.

This is because in a 45-45-90 triangle, the ratio of a leg to the hypotenuse is 1 : √2.

Therefore, we can now set up the cosine ratio as:

cos 45° = adjacent side / hypotenuse = 1 / √2
